en.replay from task tooltip: Create a similar execution starting from task {taskId}
en.replay from beginning tooltip: Create a similar execution starting from the beginning
en.replay confirm: Are you sure to replay this execution {id} and create a new one?
en.change state confirm: Are you sure you want to change the task run state for the {task} task in execution {id}?

WARNING: The flow will be marked as WARNING.
The next tasks will be executed.
The error tasks will be executed.
FAILED: The flow will be marked as FAILED.
No other task will be executed.
The error tasks will be executed.
SUCCESS: The flow will restart as this task was successful.
All the blocked tasks will be executed.
The flow will be in a SUCCESS state if all task runs are successful.
RUNNING: The flow will restart and will execute all next tasks.
All blocked tasks will be executed.

security_advice.title: Protect your instance
security_advice.content: Enable basic authentication to protect your instance.

en.execution-warn-deleting-still-running: Important Warning: We strongly recommend that you cancel this action and kill any ongoing executions first. Deleting non-terminated executions can lead to concurrency issues, flow dependency management inconsistencies, and zombie processes on your instance, which can degrade system performance. Make sure you fully understand these risks before proceeding with the deletion.

pluginPage.title1: Plugins are building blocks for your workflows.
pluginPage.title2: Search for tasks and triggers to build your flow.

fields.editor_folding_stratgy: Automatic Code Folding in the Editor

localization.label: Language and Region
localization.note: Note that this setting is used for displaying date and time properties in the UI. To schedule your flows in a timezone different than UTC, make sure to set the timezone property on the Schedule trigger in your flow code or your plugin defaults.

onboarding.no_flows: No flows available under tutorial namespace.

0.title: Welcome to Kestra!
0.content:
We're thrilled to have you here.
Let's create your first flow.

1.title:
Choose a use-case
and we'll show you how it's done!

2.title: Code Editor
2.content: Your flow is written in YAML with autocompletion and syntax validation. So simple!

3.title: Topology View
3.content: The dependency view is updating in real time. Try adding a new task and see!

5.title: Confirm and launch!
5.content: "Execute" and see your flow in action.

6.title: You’re all set!
6.content:
Check the Logs and Outputs tabs to track your execution progress.

Then, head over to the Flows page to explore other use cases.

en.no_namespaces: Zero namespaces match the search criteria.
en.system_namespace: Keep your platform in check with system flows.
en.system_namespace_description: Automate maintenance tasks, from failure alerts to automated cleanups.

empty.title: No tabs currently opened
empty.message: You can create or import namespace files from the sidebar and you can check out the introduction video for our Editor.

logs_view.compact_details: Show task logs in a compact view grouped by each task

en.trigger_check_warning: Warning: Usage of the `trigger` variable detected, executing your flow manually won't fullfill the trigger variable.

dashboard.success_ratio_tooltip: Success Ratio is the sum of SUCCESS, CANCELLED and WARNING executions divided by the total number of executions in a terminated state.
dashboard.failure_ratio_tooltip: Failed ratio is the sum of FAILED, KILLED and RETRIED executions divided by the total number of executions in a terminated state.
dashboard.trigger_disabled: This trigger can only be enabled through code.
dashboard.not_auth: You don't have the necessary permissions to view this widget.
